comment.author: 26105073@N03
comment._content: USS Rochester (CA-124), an Oregon City-class heavy cruiser, was laid down 29 May 1944 by Bethlehem Steel Co., Quincy, Mass.; launched 28 August 1945 www.history.navy.mil/danfs/r8/rochester-iii.htm Complement 1,142; armament 9 8”, 12 5”, 48 40mm., 20 20mm., 4 aircraft.... The first week of June 1957 found Rochester in San Francisco, where she acted as flagship for Fleet Adm. Chester W. Nimitz. Returning to Long Beach the June 18th, she resumed local operations her departure on 3 September 1957 for her seventh WestPac deployment. She returned to Long Beach 24 March 1958. www.history.navy.mil/danfs/r8/rochester-iii.htm
